page.title: 08The Combine Harvester
page.content: A Combine Harvester is a complicated machine.It is powered by a diesel engine.The front of the combine is called the wheat bender.Under the combine is the thresher and above that the worm gear.There are lots of types of combine.There is the Massey Fergusson,John Deer,Klaas and New Holland.Modern combines have air conditioning in their cabs.They have bright lights so that harvesting can be continued at night. A new combine costs about Â£70,000. A combine does 2 jobs,the first cutting and gathering,the second threshing and separating. A mower cuts the corn.A pick-up reel with rows of tines picks it up.The straw and grain are shaken.The grain falls through a grid,the chaff is blown away and the grain goes by pipe to a trailer.The straw falls out.
